formattedAddress: FDR Drive &, E 34th St, New York, NY 10016, USA
adrFormatAddress: FDR Drive &, E 34th St, New York, NY 10016, USA

originalText.text: Useful to download the NYC ferry app on your phone, link a card and buy your tickets. Once activated tickets are good for 2hrs, no money refunded if you activate ticket beforehand. I always wait until I see the right ferry and make sure the worker gets off then I activate ticket.

text.text: Useful to download the NYC ferry app on your phone, link a card and buy your tickets. Once activated tickets are good for 2hrs, no money refunded if you activate ticket beforehand. I always wait until I see the right ferry and make sure the worker gets off then I activate ticket.

originalText.text: $5.50 for 2 adults to ride one way, sensational. Staff is so helpful as long as you know what route you need, they tell you exactly which ferry to get on. Look at the blue dots going across the river and zoom in to find which route you need to take. They won’t know about the areas you need to get to only the route name

originalText.text:
I am utterly appalled by the horrendous experience I had with your ferry service experienced at the 34th Street station, en route to Wall Street. The treatment we received was disgraceful.

An incredibly rude staff member forced us to stand in a nearly empty line, despite our preference to sit. By boarding time, the line had inevitably grown, yet our early arrival and courtesy in letting others disembark first was completely disregarded. We were unreasonably denied boarding and subjected to passive-aggressive behavior from the staff.

This appalling practice of herding passengers like animals is beyond unacceptable. It’s offensive and deeply unprofessional. The sheer audacity to have benches at the station, yet penalize passengers for not standing in line, is both absurd and annoyed.

This experience has left us sickened and deeply disappointed.

originalText.text:
The ferry from East 34th Street to North Williamsburg was super easy to navigate! I got the app, headed to the dock, and boarded within 10 minutes. The ride over was quick and peaceful. It was awesome seeing Manhattan from afar.
Only compliant is on the way home, if the ferry is filled you have to wait for the next one to arrive. Some people missed the ferry and had to wait an hour for the next one.

originalText.text: Great way to take a ride to the Brooklyn stop and continue onto Lower Manhattan. Get a day pass and check out the stops. Ferry's are on time and quickly load and leave. BEWARE. We booked our day passes on the Waterways app, there is no eTicket or confirmation email. Luckily I took a screenshot, because there is not WiFi at the ports, so I could not access the app and you are given no barcode or anything to scan. The electronic ticketing/app is terrible and needs much improvement.
